addNew.tooltip: By adding custom currencies, you can create and manage accounts and transactions in those currencies. You'll also be able to adjust and update their exchange rates relative to your base currency. Linked accounts will automatically create required currencies.

errors.addFailed: Unexpected error. Currency is not added.

list.baseCurrencyTooltip: Your base currency. All information on dashboard is displayed in this currency

exchangeRate.disableLiveUpdate: Disable live updation to be able to set custom exchange rate.
exchangeRate.liveUpdateInfo: When enabled, custom rate is ignored.

errors.updateFailed: Unexpected error. Currency is not updated.

delete.description: Currency can only be deleted/disconnected if there's no accounts and/or transactions associated with it.
delete.disabledTooltip: You cannot delete this currency because it is still connected to account(s).

errors.deleteFailed: Unexpected error. Currency is not deleted.

setBase.label: Set as base currency
setBase.tooltip:
Mark as a base currency. All statistics and dashboard information will be displayed in this currency.

Transactions will be recalculated by exchange rate as of date of when transaction was recorded.

dialog.title: Change Base Currency?
dialog.warningText: Changing the base currency should be a very well-considered decision. Ideally, this action should be performed only once, even though there are no actual restrictions.
dialog.descriptionText: Each time you change the base currency, all transactions will be recalculated using historical exchange rates. Because of floating-point arithmetic and normal variations between base and quote currency rates, repeated recalculations may introduce small discrepancies in your reference amounts over time. Reference amounts are used to display statistics and to set your budget limits.
dialog.roundingIntro: Currency conversions use Banker's Rounding (IEEE 754 standard), also known as "round half to even". This minimizes cumulative rounding errors over many calculations.
dialog.roundingRule1: When a value is exactly halfway (e.g., 0.5), it rounds to the nearest even number
dialog.roundingStandard: This method is recommended by IFRS/GAAP accounting standards and used by major financial systems to prevent systematic bias in currency conversions.
dialog.untouchedWarning: Original transactions amount will always remain untouched!
dialog.processingTimeInfo: This might take a while if your currency is not widely-common.
dialog.restrictionWarning: You won't be able to create new accounts, transactions, and anything related to "amounts" while the process is in progress.
dialog.confirmation: Are you sure you want to proceed?

errors.changeFailed: Unexpected error. Failed to change base currency.

types.amountThresholdDescription: Notify when spending exceeds a certain amount

ai.title: AI Settings
ai.description: Configure AI-powered features like automatic transaction categorization

tabs.invalidKeysTooltip: One or more API keys are invalid

points.defaultKey: By default, AI features use our server's API key at no extra cost to you.
points.ownKey: If you add your own API key for a provider, that key will be used instead for models from that provider.
points.encrypted: Your API keys are encrypted and stored securely.
points.removal: You can remove your key anytime to switch back to the server-provided key (rate limits will be applied based on current demand).

apiKeyManager.title: API Keys
apiKeyManager.description: Add your own API keys to use specific providers
apiKeyManager.invalidKeyHelp: Add a new key below to replace this one, or remove it if you no longer need it.

deleteDialog.title: Remove API key?
deleteDialog.description: Are you sure you want to remove the {provider} API key?
deleteDialog.descriptionMultiple: AI features currently using {provider} will switch to another available provider.

notifications.saveSuccess: API key saved and validated successfully
notifications.saveFailed: API key is not working. Please verify the key is correct, has sufficient credits, and has the required permissions.

features.title: AI Features
features.description: Configure which model to use for each AI-powered feature

modelHint.text: For transaction categorization, low-cost models like Gemini Flash, Claude Haiku, or GPT-4o Mini are recommended. Categorization is a straightforward task that doesn't require expensive reasoning models. Using cheaper models lets you process more transactions at lower cost.

points.autoSync: When you sync transactions from your bank, uncategorized transactions are automatically sent to AI for categorization.
points.analysis: The AI analyzes transaction descriptions and merchant names to suggest appropriate categories from your existing category list.
points.override: You can always manually override AI-suggested categories.

modelHint.text: For statement parsing, mid-tier models like Claude Sonnet, Gemini Pro, or GPT-4o are recommended. Statement parsing requires understanding complex document structures and extracting accurate data, which benefits from more capable models. However, cheaper models like Gemini Flash or Claude Haiku can also work well for simpler statements.

points.upload: Upload a bank statement (PDF, CSV, or TXT) and AI will extract all transactions automatically.
points.analysis: The AI analyzes the document structure to identify dates, descriptions, amounts, and transaction types.
points.review: You can review and correct any extracted data before importing into your account.
points.cost: Cost is estimated before processing, yet it only reflects the approximate cost.

badges.yourKeyTooltip: This feature uses your personal API key. You have full control over usage and costs, with no rate limits from our server.
badges.serverTooltip: This feature uses our server's shared API key. It's free but may have rate limits during high demand. Add your own API key for unlimited access.

modelSelector.rateLimitWarning: Using server-provided AI with free-tier rate limiting. Feature availability depends on demand from other users. For reliable access, add your own API key in the API Keys tab.
modelSelector.addKeyHint: Add your own API key to select from all available models.

errors.cannotUseMainCategory: Cannot use main category in splits

refundInfo.title: About Refund Transactions
refundInfo.description: This action links the current transaction [expense/income] as a refund to a previous existing transaction.

howItWorks.title: How it works:
howItWorks.expenseRefund: For an expense refund: Select the original income transaction.
howItWorks.incomeRefund: For an income refund: Select the original expense transaction.
howItWorks.noOriginal: You can mark any transaction as a refund even if there's no "original" transaction in the system. Useful in case you don't have account with the original transaction in the system.

benefits.title: Benefits:
benefits.accuracy: Enhances financial accuracy by adjusting spending or income statistics to exclude refunded amounts.
benefits.tracking: Helps track related transactions to improve your feed.

notes.title: Important Notes:
notes.recordKeeping: This link is for record-keeping purposes only.
notes.noBalanceAdjust: It does not adjust the balance of the original transaction in any way.
notes.canUnlink: You can always unlink transactions back.

examples.title: Examples:
examples.customerPayment: Refunding a customer payment: Create an expense and link it to the original income.
examples.vendorRefund: Receiving a refund from a vendor: Create an income and link it to the original expense.
examples.noOriginalTx: Recording a refund without an original transaction: Sometimes you might need to record a refund for a transaction that isn't in your system. For instance, if you're recording a refund for a cash payment that wasn't initially logged, you can still create a refund entry. This helps maintain accurate records even when the original transaction isn't digitally tracked.

beta.title: Beta Feature - Developer-Oriented
beta.description: This integration requires technical knowledge to set up. You'll need to register your own Enable Banking application and provide API credentials. The setup process and API may change in future updates.

credentials.appIdHint: Get from Enable Banking portal after uploading your certificate
credentials.privateKeyHint: Your PEM-encoded RSA private key (stored encrypted)

steps.authDescription: Click the button below to authorize access to your {bank} account.
steps.authWarning: You will be redirected to {bank}'s website to log in and approve the connection.
steps.selectAccountsHint: Select the accounts you want to sync with MoneyMatter

errors.loadCountriesFailed: Failed to load countries. Please check your credentials.

instructionsDialog.title: How to Obtain Enable Banking Credentials
instructionsDialog.description: Step-by-step instructions for registering and configuring Enable Banking credentials

overview.title: Overview
overview.text: Enable Banking requires you to register an application and generate security credentials to access banking data. Follow these steps to get your Application ID and Private Key.

step1.title: Register & Create Application
step1.intro: Visit {link} and create an account if you don't have one already.

steps.login: Log in to the Enable Banking portal
steps.generateKey: Check the {strong} checkbox. Once application is created, the .pem key will be saved to your computer automatically as a file. {warning} for whatever reason – you will need to recreate the application
steps.generateKeyStrong: "Generate private RSA key in the browser"
steps.fillForm: Fill out form with the next values:
steps.downloadKey: You will be suggested to download a file. It's your RSA key that you must save somewhere since this is part of your credentials

step2.title: Link Your Bank Accounts
step2.intro: Before using the application with MoneyMatter, you must first link your bank accounts through the Enable Banking portal. Look for the "Link accounts" button inside the created application's tile and follow all the steps required there.

steps.clickLink: Click "Link accounts", wait for spinner to finish loading
steps.newFields: New fields will appear in the same spot: "Country", "ASPSP", "Usage type"
steps.redirect: You will be redirected to your banks' auth page. Login, and select all the accounts you want to connect
steps.finishAuth: Once you finish auth flow, you will be redirected back to EnableBanking
steps.waitAccounts: Wait until selected accounts are displayed in the Application's card under "Linked accounts" field

step2.warningNotLinked: It might be the case that some selected accounts are not linked. This is the problem on your bank's side which you cannot resolve by yourself. You can only wait a few hours/days until issue is resolved. If issue is not resolved, the only way is to report to EnableBanking.
step2.infoAddMore: In case in the future you would like to connect more accounts, you will need to repeat the flow of linking accounts again. {strong} that when adding NEW accounts you still need to select OLD accounts – basically you need to select ALL accounts you want to be connected.

step3.title: Get Your Credentials
step3.appId: {strong} Copy the {code} from your application details
step3.privateKey: {strong} Open your saved {code} file via some text editor (TextEdit on MacOS or Notepad on Windows) and copy its entire content (including the BEGIN and END lines)

securityNote.title: Security Note
securityNote.text: Your private key is stored encrypted in our database and is only used to authenticate with Enable Banking on your behalf. Token is limited to read-only data. Yet, never share your private key with anyone else.

errors.noAuthUrl: No authorization URL received from server

error.loadFailed: Failed to load integration details. Please try again.

connectionDetails.title: Connection Details
connectionDetails.autoSyncTooltip: Auto-sync is triggered each time you log in, if more than 12 hours have passed since the last sync. You can also trigger a sync manually from the header at any time.

connectionValidity.title: Connection Validity
connectionValidity.expiredDescription: Your bank connection has expired. Please reconnect to continue syncing transactions.
connectionValidity.expiringSoonDescription: Your bank connection will expire in {days} day(s). Please reconnect soon to avoid interruption.
connectionValidity.validConnectionHint: Connection is valid. You can still reconnect to refresh available accounts or extend the connection validity.

fetchAccountsDialog.title: Connect Remaining Accounts
fetchAccountsDialog.description: Select available accounts from {providerName} that are not yet connected.
fetchAccountsDialog.missingAccountsHint: If you can't see some of your accounts, try reconnecting your bank connection from the {section} section by clicking {button}.
fetchAccountsDialog.missingAccountsPersist: If the issue persists, please report it for further investigation.
fetchAccountsDialog.sessionExpired: Your session has expired. Please reconnect your bank connection to continue.
fetchAccountsDialog.loadFailed: Failed to load available accounts. Please try again.
fetchAccountsDialog.noAdditionalAccounts: No additional accounts available to connect.

uploadExtract.dragDropText: Drag and drop your statement file here, or

transactionReview.toggleInfo: Click on a row to toggle:

importResults.readyDescription: Review the summary below and click "Import Transactions" to proceed.
importResults.importingDescription: Please wait while we import your transactions...
importResults.successDescription: Your transactions have been successfully imported.
importResults.partialDescription: Some transactions could not be imported.
importResults.batchIdDescription: You can use this ID to find and manage all imported transactions.
